text: my name is David Schwindt I'm a police
officer for the city of Iowa City Iowa
in 2016 a few of us from Johnson County
were invited out to the Obama White
House as part of a data-driven justice
convening and that was our first
introduction today to driven justice it
is all about combining different data
sets that are traditionally siloed and
then using that combined data set to
understand outcomes of Social Services
and health services in your area
identify gaps in those services and
identify high utilizers of those
services who are cycling in and out of
jails or in and out of emergency rooms
and try and identify resources that
could be better aimed at them to prevent
them from continuing to cycle in and out
of those services that just aren't
giving them long term care that they
need
in 2014 we were manually doing this data
collection and analysis to research a
housing first option called fuse in our
area and determine the need and we ended
up doing an in-depth study on for
chronically homeless men who lived in
our area who also had substance abuse
issues and over four year period those
four men used to point one six million
dollars in local services and at the end
of the four years they were all still
homeless and all still had substance
abuse issues so after more than two
million dollars in services in our area
there was no improvement for them or for
the services or our area as a whole so
our goal is to kind of work forward and
try and find out how we can use this
data to better identify those
individuals and better provide services
to them so we don't see that repeatable
pattern with others data-driven justice
was started in the Obama White House and
the staff who started data-driven
justice have since moved on to the Laura
and John Arnold foundation right now
with that data in all of these siloed
systems we don't really know the
baseline of outcomes for the services we
have so by merging all that data
together within our AWS service we're
hoping to be able to see that baseline
so that as we introduce or change
services we can see how the outcomes are
affected and then tailor the services so
that we get
outcomes possible
[Music]
